claim: Vaccination with a higher-dose recombinant flu vaccine may induce a more robust antibody response than egg-based standard-dose vaccines.
explanation: Table listing influenza vaccines by trade name (manufacturer), presentation, age indication, antigen content per dose (μg HA for IIV4s and RIV4 or virus count for LAIV4), route of administration, and mercury content. Evidence: Flublok Quadrivalent (recombinant HA vaccine) contains 45 μg HA per strain per 0.5 mL dose versus 15 μg HA per strain per 0.5 mL for standard egg-based IIV4 vaccines. does not support the claim because the image only presents antigen dose differences without any antibody response or immunogenicity data, so it doesn't support evidence that the higher-dose recombinant vaccine induces a more robust antibody response. Note: No immunogenicity or antibody response data is provided; table only lists formulations and antigen content.
